citation.article-title: Halomonas campaniensis sp. nov., a haloalkaliphilic bacterium isolated from a mineral pool of Campania Region, Italy

p.s: Description of Halomonas campaniensis sp. nov.
H. campaniensis (cam.pa.nien'sis, N.L. fem. Adj. campaniensis, pertaining to Campania Region, southern Italy).
Cells, Gram-negative straight rods, 0.3–0.6 μm in width and 2.0–2.2 μm long.

It is mesophilic, exhibiting optimum growth temperature of 37 °C, but is able to grow between 10 and 43 °C and at pH 7.0–10.0 (9.0 optimal pH) and it tolerates up to 16% NaCl with an optimum at 10% NaCl concentration.
It is able to grow on sucrose, maltose, cellobiose, mannose, sodium acetate, fructose, glucose and glycerol as only carbon source.
It is oxidase, urease, catalase, Tween-80, tyrosine and hippurate hydrolysis and nitrate reduction positive, but negative with respect to casein, starch and phenylalanine hydrolysis.

Q8 is the only quinone found and the predominant polar lipids are phosphoethanolamine (PEA) phosphatidylglycerol (PG), diphosphatidylglycerol (DPG). aiC16:0 (22.0% of total fatty acids), and C18:1 cis (46.0% of total fatty acids) are the main cellular fatty acids, C16:1 trans, iC16:0, nC17:0, C17:1 cyclopropane, iC18:0, C18:1 trans,C19:1 trans, C19:1, and C19:1 cyclopropane are each less than 10% of total fatty acids.
Strain 5AGT accumulated glycine–betaine and ectoine as major components, and glutamate as minor osmoprotectant.
The mol% G+C content of DNA is 63.7 mol%.
The DNA–DNA hybridization of the type strain 5AGT with the most related H. campisalis showed a re-association value of 35.0%.
Strain 5AGT was sensitive to lincomycin (15), fusidic acid (10), streptomycin (25), chloramphenicol (10), erythromycin (5), gentamicin (30).
Isolated from algal mat inside a mineral pool with bubbling in Malvizza site (Campania–Italy).
Type strain 5AGT has been deposited in Deutsche Sammlung von Mikroorganismen Collection, Braunschweig, Germany (DSM 15293T=ATCC BAA-966).
